152.「またしても そなたに頼ることになるが| これは 時渡りのチカラを持つ| そなた: Once again, I must rely on you, but this is|something only you, who have the power of time|travel, can do!

153.「その前に 言っておきたいことがある。| わしは エテーネ王国について知るため|: Before I go any further, I would like to say|something. I have been scouring the archives|to learn more about the Kingdom of Etaine...

154.「高度な錬金術により 栄華を誇った王国だが| ５０００年前に 突如として 滅んだ:
It was a kingdom that boasted of its|prosperity through advanced alchemy, but all|that was written about it was that it was|
|suddenly destroyed 5,000 years ago.

155.「つまるところ おぬしは これから| 滅んだ原因も定かではない エテーネ王国へと: After all, you must now go to the kingdom of|Etaine, the cause of which is not known.

164.「ここから 入れそうですよ。| 調査なら 楽な任務かと思いましたが| めんどうな: I think I can get in here. I thought the|survey would be an easy mission, but it's|turning out to be a hassle.

170.「私は ローベル。| 我々は この辺りの警備をまかされている| エテーネ王国 辺: My name is Lobel. We are soldiers of the|Etaine Kingdom Frontier Guards, who are|entrusted with the security of this area.

171.「……貴殿は 旅の者と見た。| 何用で 訪れたのかは知らぬが| この屋敷は今 危: I see you are a traveler. I don't know what|brings you here, but this house is in a|dangerous state.

172.「即刻 立ち去ったほうがいい。| 我々の詰所が そう 遠くない場所にある。| そ: You should leave immediately. Our gatehouse is|not far away. You will be safe there.

173.「だが 我々は 調査任務があるため| 貴殿を 送っていくことは できない。| 自: However, we cannot send you to the office|because we are on an investigative mission.|You will have to go to the gate on your own.

174.「……だとさ。| よかったな あんた。| 普通なら しょっぴかれてるところだぜ。: I heard that. You're lucky. Normally, I would|have been arrested.

183.「名を 告げぬのならば| 王都へ入れることは できん。| すぐに 立ち去るがよい: If you do not tell us your name, we cannot let|you into King's Landing. Leave now.

184.「我らの持つ指針書に 記された者しか| 王都へ入ることは 許可できない決まりだ。: It is a rule that only those who have been|written in our guidebooks are allowed to enter|King's Landing. You may leave now.

|retreated.

205.「ディークの声のようです。| いったい 何が……。: It sounds like Deke's voice. What in the|world...

207.「なに！？ この辺りの魔物が| 詰所を 襲ってきたことなど| 今までに 一度も: What? There has never been a demon around here|that has ever attacked the stuffing place!

208.「それが はじめて見るヤツで| オマケに なんか 普通じゃなくて……！: It's the first time I'd ever seen one, and the first time I'd ever seen anything out of the ordinary.

209.「うひゃあっ！| こここ こいつですっ。: Oh, my gosh! Here, here, here!

216.「な……。なんなんだ あの魔物はっ。| あんなのは 見たことがないぞ！！: What... What the heck is that demon? I've|never seen anything like that before!

217.「それに なんだ あの態度は！！| 我々には もう興味がないとでも| 言いたそう: And what the hell was that attitude! It was as|if he was saying he wasn't interested in us|anymore!

218.「死んでは いないのか？| まるで 生気を抜かれたような……。: Not dead? It's as if he's been drained of|life...

222.ラゴウ隊長の命により 彼らは|襲撃をまぬがれた兵士によって 治療のため|王都へと: On the order of Captain Lagow, they were sent|back to the royal capital for treatment by|soldiers who had survived the attack.

223.「うむむ……。なんということだ。| ほとんどの隊員が あの魔物１匹に| やられて: Hmmm... what a surprise. Almost all the|members of the team were killed by that one|monster.

226.「私ひとりでは 太刀打ちできぬと判断し| 報告に戻った次第です。: I decided that I could not compete on my own,|so I returned to my report.

229.「お前に 仕事を与えよう。| あの魔物を 退治しに向かうのだ。| 屋敷への不法侵: I have a job for you. You are going to|exterminate that demon. I'm going to make your|trespassing in the mansion a non-issue.

235.「ローベルの言った 西のほら穴に向かい| 異形獣を 退治してくるのだ。| 倒した: Go to the west cave that Lobel mentioned and|kill the xenomorphs. Don't forget to bring the|proof of your defeat.

236.「……ご命令ならば 仕方ありません。| 私は 隊長の護衛として 残ります。: ...If that is your order, I have no choice. I|will remain as the captain's escort.

250.「……よくやった。約束どおり| お前の 屋敷への無断侵入の罪は| わしの権限で: ...Well done. As promised, I'll use my|authority to dismiss the charge of trespassing|into your mansion without permission.

253.そして 書いた内容をながめて|うむうむと うなずくと|その紙を 封筒に入れて 封: He looked over what he had written, nodded his|head, put the paper in an envelope, and sealed|it.

|head straight for it!

268.「<pc>。ボクたちは| 前に来たときよりも 若干 時が過ぎた状態の| 屋敷に到: <pc>. We arrived at the mansion|with a little more time than when we came|before.

269.「エテーネルキューブの調律に| すこし 乱れが 発生していて| そのせいで 時間: It seems that the tuning of the ethener cube|has been slightly disturbed, which caused the|time to be out of sync.

The "Eternel Cube" in the|"Tools" section of the main command allows you|to go back and forth between the present and|

In the past, you can use the|roof over your head. You can also return to|the original time period by selecting "Return|
|to the Present".

276.「時間が 多少ズレたとはいえ| ここが エテーネ王国のメレアーデがいた| 屋敷で:
Even though the time has shifted a little,|there is no doubt that this is the mansion|where Meleade of the Kingdom of Ethene used to|
|live.

277.「メレアーデから預かった 記憶の赤結晶を| 弟のクオードに渡して 一緒に見ること: The mission of <pc> is to give the|red crystal of memory entrusted to him by|Meleade to his brother Quaude to see together.

278.「でも 屋敷の中から キミ以外の人間の| 生体反応が まったく 感知できないキュ: But I can't detect any bio-signs from inside|the mansion except for you. It seems to me|that there is no point in being here.

279.「可及的すみやかに 屋敷の外へ脱出し| クオード探索ルートの再構築をするよう|: I suggest that they escape from the mansion as|soon as possible and reconstruct a route to|search for Quod.

280.「ボクは キューブの中に 退避しておくキュ。| 時の妖精たる者 別時間の存在と:
I will retreat into the cube. As the fairy of|time, it is necessary to avoid unnecessary|contact with other time beings as much as|
|possible.

281.「どうしたの クロちゃん？| おなか 空いちゃったのかな～？: What's wrong, Kuro? Are you hungry~?

282.「……あら？ お客様の訪問なんて| 今日の予定に あったかしら？: Oh, no. Was a client visit on the agenda for|today?

283.「あなたとは はじめて 会うわよね。| ええと。私の名前は メレアーデ。| この: This is the first time we've met, right?|Well... My name is Meleade. I am the daughter|of the owner of this house.

284.「それで いつ この部屋に入ったの？| 私 ぜんぜん 気づかなかったわ。| すご: So when did you enter this room? I didn't even|notice. You're amazing!

285.「あなたのファッションも| ずいぶんと 個性的で 興味深いわ。| どこのお店で: Your fashions are very unique and interesting.|I wonder where you bought them?

286.「……う～ん。なんだか あなた。| 何が起こったか よく わからない！| ……っ: ...Hmmm. What is it, you. I don't really know|what happened! I don't know what's going on!

287.「……もしかして ここが 有名な| ドミネウスのお屋敷ってことも| あなたには: ...Perhaps you don't know that this is the|home of the famous Dominus?

288.「でも さすがに このエテーネ王国にいて| それを知らないってことは ないわよね: But you can't be in the Kingdom of Etaine and|not know that, can you?

289.「ちょっと待って クオード。| この人も 何か とまどっているみたい。| まずは: Wait a minute, Quad. He seems to be confused|about something. You should talk to him first.

290.「……ねえ。私の声 聞こえる？| 今 開けるから ちょっと 待ってね。: ...Hey. Can you hear me? I'm going to open it|now, so wait a minute.

292.「まったく あの子ったら| ひとの話を 聞いてくれなくて| 本当に 困っちゃうわ: It's really annoying that she doesn't listen|to me at all.

293.「……と 私たちのことは 置いときましょう。: ...and let's leave us out of it.

294.「……さて。まずは| あなたの名前を 教えてくれる？: ...Well. Can you tell me your name first?

296.「あなたのこと……。| クオードは 極悪人のように 言ってたけど| 私には とて: About you... you made Quad sound like a|nefarious person, but I don't think that's|very true of me.

297.「だって あなたは とても| 優しそうな目を しているもの……。| 私 ひとを見: Because you have such kind eyes... I'm very|confident in the way I look at people!

298.「だから ここから 出してあげる。| だいじょうぶ。後のことは 心配ないわ。|: So I'm going to get you out of here. Don't|worry. Don't worry about the rest. Quaude has|already left for King's Landing.

299.「それで あなたは| どうやって ここに 来たの？| エテーネ王国の人じゃないみ: So how did you get here? You don't seem to be|from the Kingdom of Etaine.

300.「……えっ？ 銀色の箱のチカラで| ここに とんできたんですって？: What? I heard that you flew here with the|power of the silver box?

301.「あれ……。| それじゃ あの箱がないと| 帰ることも できないってことじゃ……: That... that means I can't even go home|without that box...

302.「でも 心配しないで！| クオードは この家から| 箱を 持ちだしたりしてないわ: But don't worry! Quad didn't take the box out|of this house.

303.「あとで ゆっくり 調べるつもりで| 自分の部屋に しまってあると思うの。| あ: I think she keeps them in her room to examine|them later. I'm sure she will.

304.「クオードの部屋を探せば| きっと 銀色の箱が 見つかるはずよ！: I'm sure if you search Quad's room you'll find|a silver box!

305.「あなたは 私のお客さんってことにしてあるから| すこしくらい うろついても 問: You're supposed to be my guest, so it's okay|if you hang around a little bit. Quad's room|is on the third floor, west side!

306.「あら？ 早かったわね。| そう。ここが クオードの部屋よ。: Oh? That was fast. Yeah. This is Quaude's|room.

307.「それじゃ あの子には悪いけど| 部屋の中を かきまわして| 銀色の箱とやらを:
Well then, I'm sorry to be that girl, but|let's rummage around the room and see if we|can find that silver box or whatever it's|
|called.

308.「ふふっ。なんだか 楽しいわ。| 何か おもしろいものも 出てくるかも？: Hmmm. That's kind of fun. Maybe something|interesting will come out of it?

309.「見つからないわね 箱……。| 私のカンも にぶっちゃったなあ。: I can't find the box... I guess my instincts|are off too.

310.「おもしろいものも 出てこないし| ちょっと ガッカリだわ。: I'm a little disappointed that nothing|interesting has come out of it.

311.「クオードは あの箱を持ったまま| 王都に 行っちゃったのかなあ。| う～ん……: I wonder if Quaid went to King's Landing with|that box. Hmmm...

312.「……あっ そうだわ。| ちょっと 玄関にいる執事のジェリナンに| 話を聞きにい: ...Oh, that's right. Let's go talk to Jerinan,|the butler at the entrance.

313.「彼なら 出ていくときのクオードを| 見かけているはずだから| そのときの様子を: He would have seen Quad when he left, so he|might remember what he looked like then.

314.「それじゃ １階の玄関まで お願い。| ジェリナンは すこし 気むずかしい人だけ: Then please go downstairs to the front door.|Gelinand may be a bit difficult, but I'm sure|he'll help you out!

315.「もう～。ジェリナンてば| 本当に おカタいんだから！: Oh my god! Jerinan, you're so stiff!

316.「あのね。クオードが でかけるとき| 何か 持ってなかったか 教えてほしいのよ。: You know what? I need to know if Quad had|anything on him when he left.

317.「ああっ まずいわ。| ジェリナンのお小言が 始まっちゃう！: Oh, no. Jellinan's going to start pestering|me!

318.「はい そこまで！ お小言なら| あとで いくらでも聞くって 約束するから| 今: That's enough! I promise I'll listen to all|your nonsense later, but for now, tell me|about Quad!

319.「お待ちになって ジェリナン！| お客様の前で お説教を始めるのも| いかがなも: Wait for me, Jellinan! I don't think it's a|good idea to start preaching in front of our|guests!

320.「……そう。それなら いいの。| 感謝するわ ジェリナン！: ...Yeah. That's okay then. I appreciate it,|Jellinan!

321.「<pc>！ やっぱり あの箱は| まだ この屋敷の中にあるのよ。: <pc>! I knew that box is still in|this mansion.

322.「クオードが 自分の部屋の他に| あの箱を 隠しそうな所となると| う～ん……。: The only other place I can think of where Quad|might hide that box besides his own room is...|hmmm...

323.「あっ！ クオードの部屋から| ここに来るまでの間に テラスの前を通るわ。| も: Ah! I'll pass by the terrace on the way from|Quad's room to here. Maybe on the terrace...?

324.「たしか 今日は 侍女のハーミィが| テラスの お掃除当番の日ね。| 彼女が 何: I think today is the day that Hermie, the maid|of honor, is in charge of cleaning the|terrace. She might know something.

325.「<pc>。| 次は ハーミィに 話を聞いてみて。| テラスは ３階の北側よ！: <pc>. Talk to Hermie next. The|terrace is on the third floor, north!

326.「うふふ ハーミィ。| まだ そんなに 緊張しているの？: Ummm Hermie. Are you still so nervous?

327.「私には そんな かたくるしい言葉を| 使わなくていいって 言ったでしょ。| 普: I told you, you don't have to use such stiff|language with me. Just be normal, normal.

328.「彼女は この屋敷に来てから| まだ 日が浅いの。| ジェリナンにも しかられま: She hasn't been here long. Jellinan has been|giving her a lot of grief.

329.「ふふっ。あやまらなくても いいわ。| 私たち あなたに 聞きたいことがあって|: Hmmm. No need to apologize. We're here to ask|you some questions, if you don't mind.

330.「ちょっとね。探し物をしているの。| これくらいの 銀色の箱っぽいものなんだけど: Just a minute. I'm looking for something. I'm|looking for something silver, like a box, but|I don't know if you've seen it around here.

331.「そう……。じゃあ クオードの様子に| 変わったところとか なかったかしら？|: Well... then did you notice anything unusual|about Quad's behavior? Like, did he go out on|the terrace with something or something?

333.「ありがとう ハーミィ。| じゅうぶん 役に立ったわ。| ポーラに 会いにいって: Thank you Hermie. You've been very helpful.|I'm going to go see Paula.

335.「ポーラが きっと 何かを知っているはずよ。| 侍女たちの部屋なら この３階にあ: I'm sure Paula will know something. The maids'|quarters are on this third floor.

338.「……本当に？| さっき <pc>に 答えたことも| ウソではないって 言えるの: ...Really? So you can say you didn't lie about|answering <pc> earlier either?

339.「私の目を見ながら そう言える？: Can you look me in the eye and say that?

342.「それなら 屋敷に置いてあるものを| 持ちだしても よかったはずよ。| なぜ <: Then you could have taken the stuff from the|mansion. Why the <pc> box?

343.「この屋敷のものでなければ| よいなんて考えは まちがっているわ。| その前に: It is wrong to think that it should not belong|to this mansion. You should have consulted me|before...

344.「ねえ <pc>。| 私から お願いがあるの。| ポーラを ゆるしてあげてくれる: Hey <pc>. I have a favor to ask.|Will you let Paula go...?<yesno><close>

345.「ポーラも あやまりなさい。| それとね…… お母さんのことは| 私に まかせて: Paula, you should apologize too. And hey...I|want you to let me take care of your mom.

347.「それじゃあ <pc>。| ２階の 東側の客間を探してみて。| 今度こそ 銀色の: Well then <pc>, go upstairs and|look in the guest room on the east side. This|time you should find a silver box!

348.「銀色の箱 見つかったのね。| これで <pc>も ひと安心！: I see you found the silver box. Now|<pc> can breathe a sigh of relief!

349.「ところで……。ずっと 気になってたけど| その箱って なんなのかしら？| クオ: By the way... I've always wondered what that|box was. Quaid said it was from Etaine.
